text: oh :wave: <@U25C6PU56>… good to see you here, old friend.

<@UFYUD2BB9> :wave: Hi Joel! Yup, HubSpot is my jam. Glad to see you in the channels. And yes, <@U22PKFRU5> is correct that I’m doing a lot of work CMS menus lately. Hoping to have something cool to share in March for the community.
Alright, so. If I need to roll my own. Is there a method within HubL to query a menu that’s been created by a user, split it all apart, and rebuild the markup? Like some filtering method or similar?

no, if you built it with HubDB you’d ignore the advanced menu system alltogether.

If you want to keep using the advanced menu system but change the markup and all that jazz you’ll need to use JS.
yeah the issue is that it’s a client’s site. So they need to be able to use the interface while I need to make this conform to WCAG standards.
